channel.title: Server Errors and Global Objects
channel.description:
Shortly after reading -fedexers- guide on global objects I started my server to see if it my ability to follow directions was a success, And as far as I thought, it was. I had 2 perfectly placed portals. Unfortunately my happiness was sucked away as soon as I recieved the Connection Lost - Attempting to re-establish message. At first I thought this was O.K. I mean, it happens to everyone once and a while, But second after second it did it again, And I noticed this message appearing over and over again in the console window.
[code] Starting [xL] Scape Server. ClientHandler: Accepted from localhost:2086 Ghost is signing onto server. Ghost: character file not found. java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 15745 at client.parseIncomingPackets(client.java:16504) at client.packetProcess(client.java:15309) at client.process(client.java:15279) at PlayerHandler.process(PlayerHandler.java:137) at server.main(server.java:50) [xL] Scape [FATAL] - exception Could not save for Ghost ClientHandler: Client Ghost disconnected. [/code]
Frantically. I decided to go back into my client.java and delete anything to do with those damned Global Objects. I compiled and restarted my server. Again with my misfortune I wasnt awarded for my efforts, the problem was still occuring !
Long story short: What can I do to stop this ?
Edit - Im wondering if my question is ever going to be answered? . It always seems like you have the people that help others do things that are the easiest, then when the come upon a message like mine, they decide to back away until another person asks 'how i mke rs servr plx' then they jump right on the case. I just hope this time my question isnt flooded out by useless questions again.

item.title: Server Errors and Global Objects
item.dc:creator: @jbblaze jbblaze
item.description:
@jbblaze wrote:

[quote=“jc22493, post:5, topic:70679”][quote author=jbblaze link=topic=103855.msg2719945#msg2719945 date=1237918653]
same problem except i stop at the character file not found- dont even make it to a black screen.
[/quote]
Stop grave-digging![/quote]

WTF am i supposed to do? ive got tons of angry players yelling at me- and ive made 2 topics of my own un-responded, not only do i want HIS problem solved- but mine too.

Read full topic

item.title: Server Errors and Global Objects
item.dc:creator: @jbblaze jbblaze
item.description:
@jbblaze wrote:

same problem except i stop at the character file not found- dont even make it to a black screen.

Read full topic

item.title: Server Errors and Global Objects
item.dc:creator: @Snark Snark
item.description:
@Snark wrote:

That doesnt make any sense. I’ve deleted the character, and i’ve made new ones as well. It has something to do with the Global Objects… I just dont know what.

Edit - Just to entertain you i’ve copied the console when I tried to connect with a NEW character.

ClientHandler: Accepted from localhost:2367
Test is signing onto server.
Test: character file not found.
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 15745
        at client.parseIncomingPackets(client.java:16504)
        at client.packetProcess(client.java:15309)
        at client.process(client.java:15279)
        at PlayerHandler.process(PlayerHandler.java:137)
        at server.main(server.java:50)
[xL] Scape [FATAL] - exception
Could not save for Test
ClientHandler: Client Test disconnected.

Read full topic

item.title: Server Errors and Global Objects
item.dc:creator: @Dell Dell
item.description:
@Dell wrote:

Means the char, “ghost”, has an item that is not supported my the cache.

Read full topic
